#Text=La Fortuna
#Text=La Fortuna de San Carlos is a small town in the north of Costa Rica .
#Text=Understand
#Text=La Fortuna is mostly famous for the nearby Arenal Volcano ( 1,633 m ) .
#Text=The Arenal Volcano is a destination for scientists and tourists .
#Text=La Fortuna was called " El Borio " before the day of a huge eruption in 1968 , when the volcano erupted to the east and destroyed all in its path , including two villages .
#Text=El Borio ( La Fortuna ) is located on the west side of the volcano and was untouched .
#Text=After the eruption of the volcano , El Borio was renamed " La Fortuna " , which means " the fortunate " , referring to the town 's luck during the eruption .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There are direct buses from San José or with transfer in Ciudad Quesada ( San Carlos ) .
#Text=Also , buses from San Ramon ( Costa Rica ) .
#Text=There is one local bus per day from Tilaran .
#Text=From Peñas Blancas ( Nicaraguan border ) take San Carlos bus ( US$ 8 ) and alight at Tanque , take bus or taxi to La Fortuna ( 7 km away ) .
#Text=When leaving La Fortuna , bus schedules seem to be highly arbitrary and unreliable .
#Text=The more often you ask , the more departure times they will tell you .
#Text=Some touts will try to exploit this situation .
#Text=It is best to approximately have a bus departure time , arrive a little earlier and plan for 1 hr waiting or so .
#Text=By private shuttle
#Text=The cost of a private transportation with a Costa Rican driver is not much if you compare it with the benefit of a direct safe drive to the destination .
#Text=Available from San Jose to Arenal and other destinations .
#Text=By car
#Text=It is a 3½-hour drive from San José , but the junctions are not very well marked , so bring a good map .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Domestic flights are available with Aerobell Airlines or Sansa Airlines .
#Text=Costs around US$ 90 for flights to/from San José ( SJO ) or Quepos ( Manuel Antonio National Park ) .
#Text=Airport charges US$7/person departure tax .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The are just one or two buses that go around the volcano .
#Text=Generally , most tourists rely on taxis or their own cars ( everywhere you will have to pay for parking ) .
#Text=Hitch-hiking is actually a reasonable option and quite easy if you are travelling on a tight budget .
#Text=This way you can reach the park entrance , trails or hot springs time independently and fast .
#Text=See

#Text=Arenal Volcano – The photos at the right of this articles are views from the village of El Castillo , on the southwest side of the Volcano , about 25 km west of La Fortuna and about 4 km up the road from the Arenal National Park entrance .
#Text=There are great views of Lake Arenal and the Monteverde Cloud Forest from road up above El Castillo .
#Text=In October 2010 , the volcano ceased its activity and the famous flowing lava has been gone since .
#Text=Seeing some smoke during the day is possible , however , do not expect to see lava/eruptions in the night , regardless of clouds .
#Text=This could change at any time .

#Text=Tours to the National Park usually start out in the early afternoon and include walking for about an hour through lava rocks before reaching El Mirador , the best place to view the eruption of the volcano .
#Text=There are also possibilities of skipping the lava rock walking and go straight to El Mirador .
#Text=Most tours state that they will stay for 1-1½ hours at this place , but if there is nothing to be seen , probably a lot less .
#Text=It might be chilly , so bring a jacket .
#Text=The tours come in a variety of options : with buffet dinner and entrance to the Tabacon hot spa $ 64 , with entrance to Baldi hot spa $ 30 , just the tour $ 25 .
#Text=There is also a possibility of a no-frills tour by mini-bus to El Mirador and back to Fortuna for $ 10 .
#Text=Lake Arenal – just west of the Arenal Volcano and can be seen as you drive over the dam on the main highway to Tilaran .
#Text=Much better views of the lake and volcano can be seen from the hills above the village of El Castillo , which is located 9 km from the main highway on the Arenal National Park road .
#Text=Activities on lake include boat tours , fishing , kayaking , and wind surfing .
#Text=Fortuna Waterfall ( Catarata Río Fortuna ) , ☏ +50624799515 , ✉ info@arenaladifort.com .
#Text=entrance closes 17:00 .
#Text=Stone steps lead to the bottom .
#Text=Take a swimsuit for the pool in the lovely stream below .
#Text=The entrance is accessible by road , so a cab works fine too .
#Text=Once you pay to go in , you are free to stay as long as you 'd like .
#Text=It 's about a 10-min hike down to the waterfall and 20 min back up .
#Text=US$ 18 .
#Text=Do
#Text=River pool .
#Text=Take a dip in the refreshing waters of Río Fortuna and use the El Salto Rope Swing to jump into the water .
#Text=Arenal Butterfly Conservatory , El Castillo Village - Arenal Volcano ( 20 km west of La Fortuna , turn left at the Arenal Volcano National Park Road and follow the signs .
#Text=The Butterfly Conservatory is 9 km from main highway . ) , ☏ +506 2479-1149 .

#Text=A visit to the Butterfly Conservatory offers a practical educational experience about nature with diversified exhibits of how butterflies , frogs , insects , and plants are reproduced in this natural environment .

#Text=There are six large atrium habitats that provide representation of the plants , trees , butterflies , and frogs that live within the four micro-climates surrounding Lake Arenal ; the lowland habitat , highland habitat , edge of forest habitat , and inside of forest habitat .
#Text=You will also see laboratories , reproduction greenhouses , the exotic frog habit , host plant gardens and orchid atrium .

#Text=If you want more adventure , then take the Rainforest River Walk along Quebrada Mariposa , the creek running through the primary forest on the property , where it ’s often possible to spot animals such as sloths , tayras and monkeys ; or toucans and parrots .
#Text=Or , just take time to reflect at the Volcano View Gazebo , overlooking the botanical gardens , with views to the Arenal lake and volcano beyond .
#Text=US$ 12 .
#Text=Caño Negro Wild Life Refuge .
#Text=Rio Frío are biological humid areas considered to be one of the richest in biological diversity in Costa Rica .
#Text=Here you can find a great variety of resident and migratory birds plus three different species of monkeys , also iguanas , sloths , turtles and caymans .
#Text=Along the river you can see many birds , howler monkeys , spider monkeys , white-faced monkeys , also the three-toed sloth and some reptiles like caimans , Jesus Christ lizard and turtles .
#Text=Canyoneering ( Waterfall-Rappelling ) – In the Lost Canyon .
#Text=Horseback ride to Monteverde – Travel the old fashioned way by horse
#Text=US$ 75 .
#Text=This is a gorgeous 2½-hour horseback ride along the beautiful Lake Arenal on wonderful , and hopefully healthy horses .
#Text=Fishing , kayak , etc.
#Text=at the lake
#Text=–
#Text=For entertainment a boat navigates around the Arenal lake , so that you can appreciate the unparalleled views .
#Text=Also , kayaks and other water activities can be done at the lake .
#Text=Of course the main attraction is the fishing .
#Text=The lake has many species of fish but the " Guapote " Bass is most prevalent ; this fish is a close relative of the peacock bass and is just as strong .
#Text=Other fish like the Mojara are also prevalent , think ' kin to the piranha but fruit eaters ' .
#Text=River cruises – On the Peña Blancas river , costs around US$ 45 .
#Text=White water rafting – On the Mighty Río Toro ( Class 3-4 ) , with over 45 exciting and continuous rapids that move through 16 km of deep-canyon gorges passing waterfalls in a tropical canyon .
#Text=Another option is the Beautiful Río Balsa ( Class 2-3 ) .
#Text=FlyZone Wakeboard Center on Lake Arenal , Lake Arenal ( Puerto San Luís ) , ☏ +506 8339-5876 .
#Text=Lake Arenal is starting to develop into the wakeboard center of Costa Rica .
#Text=Here you can learn how to wakeboard while the monkeys are watching you from the shore ; an unforgettable experience .
#Text=Always calm water to be found , and year round good air- and water temperatures .
#Text=For 2018 : from one hour for US$ 140 up to a full day ( 8 hr ) for US$ 820 per group of 1-4 people .
